title: [BUG] Node lost synchronisation during 20 minutes
body:
## Description

Yesterday, between 06:31-06:50 a.m (UTC), our beacon node was no longer synchronised, resulting in missed attestations and a missed block.

After digging in the logs, we saw that everything was working and then we start seeing errors:

```bash
Sep 17 06:21:17.000 INFO Synced                                  slot: 7342304, block: 0x43c2…e036, epoch: 229447, finalized_epoch: 229445, finalized_root: 0x313c…2695, exec_hash: 0x9a48…f10c (verified), peers: 88, service: slot_notifier
Sep 17 06:21:24.262 INFO New block received                      root: 0x7551a2a663187705ef838d05f63efc080780250973918f2c944c0f5031767e43, slot: 7342305
Sep 17 06:21:29.000 INFO Synced                                  slot: 7342305, block: 0x7551…7e43, epoch: 229447, finalized_epoch: 229445, finalized_root: 0x313c…2695, exec_hash: 0x889f…3540 (verified), peers: 88, service: slot_notifier
Sep 17 06:21:36.801 INFO New block received                      root: 0x485652a76b9ab673dabd6c356ec6fd13840ff5d8c76944a55412eba425b9c057, slot: 7342306

```

## Present Behaviour

Without any action on our side, the beacon node self-healed after ~ 20 minutes.

## Version

`v4.3.0` running on Kubernetes

On https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/issues/4746, @michaelsproul said:

> If you haven't already, try v4.4.1. We adjusted the scheduling of tasks in order to prevent high-priority work from being starved, which we think was leading to the node falling behind like this.
